page.title: 16THORNHILL CLUBS
page.content: There are six kinds of youth clubs in the village; Scouts, Cubs, Guides, Brownies, Toddlers and the Playgroup. Like almost all rural communities, we have a W.R.I. (Womans Rural Institute). This is important in a community like this as it is often the only chance ladies have of meeting one another. The W.R.I. have speakers, and competitions, eg. for the best "Tattie scones", the best raspberry jam, and the best hand-knitted jacket. There is a Drama Club which does two productions a year, usually a play in the summer, and a pantomime at Christmas. There is also a Gardening Club which meets once a month. There is also a T.O.F.F.S. club (Thornhill OLd Folks Friendly Society) for older people. They meet once a month.
